results.title: Mr. Fish and Lotis
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
This video features the character’s Mr. Fish (the security guard) and Lotis (a lift) in a combination of songs and stories. Lotis is no ordinary lift - she can travel with children to any place and any time. Mr. Fish is in a glass booth that makes him look like he is in an enormous fish bowl surrounded by a bank of TV monitors.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Edgar, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Lift-off at the Wackadoo Cafe
results.creator_credit: Paul Nichola, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
How do you get to the Wackadoo Cafe? All you need to do is shout “Wackadoo” and you’re there! These are 10 episodes of Wackadoo Cafe from the children’s TV series Lift off, as seen on ABC TV. Wackadoo is a crazy cafe run under the strict orders of ‘The Boss’. ‘Zelda’ the waitress weaves confidently amongst the customers, while ‘Nearly’ is nervously in charge of the drinks. ‘Cook’ a true artiste, creates works of genius in the kitchen. Regular customers are ‘Wolf’, a faded star, and the three pigs ‘Boris’, ‘Doris’ and ‘Moris’, who invariably display their mean streak. ‘Lonely’ is there too, always waiting for a friend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Nichola, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: EC, Poss & Kim
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Colin Budds, Steve Steve Jodrell, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Four stories from the popular series about the doll, EC and the two little girls, Poss and Kim. “Going under”: Kim is pushed under at the pool and is helped to face her fear of water. “Fun Day”: Poss and Kim have tickets to the fun park. “Growing up”: Kim overcomes her fears at the gym. “True friend”: Poss comes to understand true friendship.

results.title: The Story of EC
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Four stories that tell how EC came to live with Nipper Poss and Kim. “A Load of old rubbish”: A scruffy old doll called EC falls off a dump truck and is rescued and cleaned by Poss and Kim. “Out of order”: Nipper loses EC in the rain and EC disappears down the drain. “Clash”: Poss and Kim argue over EC’s role in a game and pull the doll apart. “Destroy”: Nipper thinks he is too old for dolls and tries to reject EC.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Edgar and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Imagine, EC and me
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, Ray Boseley, Brendan Maher, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones, Susie Campbell, Sandra Alexander, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
The Lift Off kids return in a brand new series with lots of fun and two new friends, Raph and Mario Ponti. We also meet Mr. Fish as a child in this delightful combination of songs and episodes. “Brand new”: EC and the Lift Off kids meet Raplh and Mario Ponti who arrive in time for Mario to help Nipper learn to rollerblade. “Under pressure”: Kim would do anything to be Princess Joanna in the school play, even trade EC! “Out of this world”: Aku’s goldfish Herbie is gone but not forgotten when he returns to haunt the plumbing! “Imagine EC and me”: Mr. Fish learns what it is like to be a child again with a little help from EC.

results.title: EC, Nipper and Aku
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Nipper and Aku are great friends. They share a world of fun and imagination, and they share EC as well! ‘Cherry Pie’ - Nipper, Aku, Paul and Poss visit Grandma’s and Grandpa’s farm. They go on a treasure hunt and are treated to Grandpa’s cherry pie. ‘Aku and the Dinosaur’ - Aku pretends to be a dinosaur, but she upsets her friends when she goes too far. ‘EC belongs to everybody’ - Nipper locks EC away and won’t let Aku play with the doll. But when he finds out that he’s left out of everything, he shares EC again. ‘Aliens above’ - When Aku and Nipper hear strange noises from upstairs, they decide an alien lives there. The older kids don’t believe it, so the two of them go to find out the truth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Steve Jodrell, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: EC and the lift-off kids
results.creator_credit: Amanda Smith, Steve Joddrell, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Three more adventures with EC. In “Scratch it” Nipper wants to be a grown up so he can do fun things with EC and his friends like camping, so the children decide to camp in the backyard. In “All together now” Nipper hurts his knee while playing in a vacant block. In “For sale” the children have turned an old warehouse into their own theatre, but find out that the warehouse is going to be sold.

results.title: Animated stories
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
These animated stories from the television series “Lift Off”, written by leading Australian children’s authors such as Paul Jennings and Jean Hepworth, open up a new world of fantasy and imagination for children. This collection of ten short films displays the work of some of Australia’s most talented animators. The titles included are “Snookle”, “Hunting the not fair”, “Rough, rough”, “Jason becomes a giant”, “Molly’s sock”, “Ice flowers”, “Murgatroyd’s garden”, “Dancing pants”, “Fair swap” and “Burping baby”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Edgar and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Occupational First Aid
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Occupational First Aid is the emergency treatment for accidents or illnesses which occur in the workplace. This program looks at the skills required to be a First Aider and at the content and location of First Aid kits in the workplace. First Aiders must be multi-skilled persons able to provide emergency treatment, make decisions regarding treatment or refer, dress and re-dress minor injuries, maintain and stock First Aid kits, actively participate in Safety programs and be familiar with the workplace.

Occupational First Aid is the emergency treatment for accidents or illnesses which occur in the workplace. This program looks at the skills required to be a First Aider and at the content and location of First Aid kits in the workplace. First Aiders must be multi-skilled persons able to provide emergency treatment, make decisions regarding treatment or refer, dress and re-dress minor injuries, maintain and stock First Aid kits, actively participate in Safety programs and be familiar with the workplace.
